activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shad A. Relerford

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:51 PM Defendant Shad A. Relerford in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.W., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim B.W., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
